notes: Third generation Outlander with available third-row seating. S-AWC (Super All-Wheel Control) system available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Outlander article, January 17, 2025 revision.

engines: 2.0L I4 + dual electric motors (197 hp combined)
2.4L I4 + dual electric motors (221 hp combined, 2019+)
notes: World's first plug-in hybrid SUV. 12 kWh lithium-ion battery (13.8 kWh from 2019). Twin-motor AWD with front and rear electric motors. High-voltage system servicing requires EV-certified technicians. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Compact crossover positioned below Outlander. Known as ASX in some markets, RVR in others. Manual transmission available early in production. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi RVR article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Compact crossover reviving Eclipse nameplate. Turbocharged 1.5L engine with CVT. S-AWC system available on AWD models. Turbocharger maintenance requires attention to oil change intervals. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Eclipse Cross article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Tenth generation compact sedan. Sportback hatchback variant available 2010-2015. AWD available on certain trims. Discontinued after 2017 model year in North America. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Lancer article, January 17, 2025 revision.

High-performance AWD sport sedan with turbocharged 4B11T engine. S-AWC (Super All-Wheel Control) with Active Yaw Control. Twin-Clutch SST transmission on GSR models requires specialized service. Timing chain maintenance critical. Final Edition (2015) produced 303 hp. Requires premium fuel and frequent maintenance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Subcompact hatchback with three-cylinder engine. Sixth generation 2014-2016, seventh generation 2017+. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Mirage article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Early electric vehicle with 16 kWh lithium-ion battery (330-cell LEV50 modules). Range approximately 62 miles. Rear-wheel drive with rear-mounted electric motor. CHAdeMO DC fast charging. Early EV technology requires specialized diagnostic equipment and high-voltage safety procedures. Limited parts availability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi i-MiEV article, January 17, 2025 revision.
